text: The 1996 U.S. Women's Open was the 51st U.S. Women's Open, held May 30 to June 2 at Pine Needles Lodge and Golf Club in Southern Pines, North Carolina. Defending champion Annika Sörenstam retained the title, six strokes ahead of runner-up Kris Tschetter. It was the second of her ten major titles; her third came nearly five years later. ESPN and NBC Sports televised the tournament. Sörenstam was the sixth of seven to win consecutive titles at the U.S. Women's Open, most recently accomplished by Karrie Webb in 2001, also at Pine Needles. The championship returned to the venue for a third time in 2007, won by Cristie Kerr. This was the first women's major with a winner's share of $200,000 or more; the U.S. Women's Open became the tour's richest major this year, passing the LPGA Championship. ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total||To par||Finish |- |align=left| Annika Sörenstam ||align=left| || 1995||70||67||69||66||272||−8||1 |- |align=left|Pat Bradley||align=left| || 1981||74||70||67||69||288||E||T3 |- |align=left|Jane Geddes||align=left| || 1986 ||71||69||70||70||280||E||T3 |- |align=left|Laura Davies||align=left| || 1987 ||74||68||70||69||281||+1||6 |- |align=left|Liselotte Neumann ||align=left| ||1988 ||74||69||70||70||283||+3||T8 |- | align=left|Patty Sheehan ||align=left| || 1992, 1994 ||74||71||72||69||286||+6||T14 |- |align=left| Meg Mallon ||align=left||| 1991 ||77||69||72||70||287||+7||T19 |- |align=left|Jan Stephenson ||align=left| || 1983 ||77||70||75||73||295||+15||T54 |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- |align=left|Hollis Stacy||align=left| || 1977, 1978, 1984||74||75||149||+9 |- |align=left|JoAnne Carner||align=left| || 1971, 1976 ||74||77||151||+11 |- |align=left| Lauri Merten ||align=left| || 1993||77||74||151||+11 |- |align=left|Betsy King||align=left| || 1989, 1990 ||81||77||158||+18 |} Source: ==Round summaries== ===First round=== Thursday, May 30, 1996 {| class="wikitable" !
